statement: The Indian economy saw a strong recovery and progress towards normalcy.
The Bank's mobile applications have become universal and open architecture, enabling expansion of services.
Core operating profit increased by 22.3% on a year-on-year basis.
The Bank's net non-performing assets decreased from 1.14% at March 31, 2021 to 0.76% at March 31, 2022.
The Bank's total capital adequacy ratio was 19.16% as against the requirement of 11.70%.
The Bank reported a revaluation gain amounting to ` 1,724.9 million on account of revaluation carried out.
Total fixed assets increased to ` 93,738,159 from ` 88,775,806.
Interest earned increased to ` 954,068,654 from ` 891,626,638.
Net profit after minority interest increased to ` 251,100,960 from ` 183,843,186.
The average liquidity coverage ratio of the Bank for the three months ended March 31, 2022 was 131.09%.
The year ended with challenges of high energy prices and inflation.
The Bank's provisions and contingencies increased from 2021 to 2022.
The Bank's net impairment ratio decreased from 2.2% at March 31, 2021 to 2.0% at March 31, 2022.
The Bank's total other assets decreased to ` 713,988,010 from ` 869,447,777.
Total provisions and contingencies increased to ` 159,108.2 million from ` 202,044.4 million.
The Bank's operating expenses increased to ` 731,517,275 from ` 762,716,696.
The Bank's total contingent liabilities increased to ` 45,523,411,167 from ` 30,213,442,288.
The Bank's deferred tax assets decreased to ` 79,484,847 from ` 93,350,216.
The Bank aims to grow its risk-calibrated core operating profit by conducting business within well-defined risk tolerance levels.
The Bank will continue to maintain a strong risk and capital management strategy while pursuing growth opportunities.
The future trajectory of the pandemic may have an impact on the results of the Bank and the Group.
The Bank will need to incorporate regulatory guidelines and clarifications in some critical areas of Ind AS application.
The Bank is exposed to various risks, including credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk, operational risk, technology risk, and compliance risk.
The ongoing geopolitical tensions and inflationary pressures could impact the Bank's performance.
The Bank's liquidity management is subject to regulatory requirements and market conditions.
The Bank faces risks related to changes in market interest rates and currency rates.
The Bank's exposure to sensitive sectors may impact its financial performance.
